Reviews.Title: “Expensive and Small - ain't all hotels in Venice are?”
Reviews.Author: zepolartim
Reviews.Content: The hotel's location is nice, near the train station, cafes and canal. Although you have to walk a few minutes into a teeny tiny street from the main touristy area, (and might accidentally step on dog poop), the street maze is usual in Venice. It was the most expensive accommodation we had in Europe and was the smallest. The bathroom was tiny, the room was basic -bed, side table, lamp, small closet. Our room was located in ground floor where you can see the patio/garden. Its a good room if you like to drink, chat and eat pizza at the patio under the stars, otherwise its a terrible idea if you would like a decent sleep cause you can hear people chitchatting. The breakfast was Ok, the staffs were ok and the small, pricey room was also ok, BUT it was not GREAT. I am open to try other accommodation if I have to go back to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms & Friendly Staf”
Reviews.Author: AhmedDin
Reviews.Content: Rooms were very clean and place was so close to main train station. it was hardly 5 min walk. Staff was very friendly and helpful and was able to speak good english. Internet is not free but they give you 30 min complimentary. wifi is only in reception and ground floor.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Good price”
Reviews.Author: 59_Ford
Reviews.Content: First time travelers to Venice should consider this hotel. While the many canals of Venice provide a unique charm that other cities don't have, the canals can be a challenge in getting your luggage to a hotel. In most cities you can take a taxi directly to your hotel, but not in Venice. On our last trip to Italy we took the train from Rome to Venice and selected this hotel because it was the closest to the train station. The hotel is an easy walk, with luggage, from the train station. The hotel is located at the end of a very narrow street but rooms are large and very comfortable. This is not the fanciest hotel in Venice but it is one of the best bargains. The hotel staff was always helpful and spoke perfect English. The only negative on this hotel is finding it. It would help to have a sign at the entrance to the street but just look for the first narrow alley on your left. (Walk out of main entrance to train station, down the steps, turn left before your reach Grand Canal, the alley is on the left about 80 yards past the canal bridge, walk down the alley another 100 yards)

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem in Venice”
Reviews.Author: FlyAtNIght
Reviews.Content: Finding reasonably a reasonably priced hotel in Venice is difficult, almost as difficult as finding this hotel. It's ideally located, just a few minutes walk from the train station...that if you can find it. It's located on a "street" which is so narrow, that I could almost touch both sides with my arms stretched. However, once I finally found it, it was worth it. Everything is Venice is expensive. I guess partly because there aren't any roads and everything is shipped by boat. Villa Rosa is an inexpensive hotel in an expensive city. However, it's excellent value, and in an ideal location. We walked to all of Venice's attractions (Venice is not a large city), but I'd recommend having a street map, as it can get confusing negotiating the street network at times. Ask for a room with balconies if possible. I didn't have one, but would like one on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Its ok for the money, no frills”
Reviews.Author: kevyt
Reviews.Content: This is the second time i've stayed here. Its a little tired, but very clean and very well located just a few minutes walk from the Railway station. There are plenty of cafes, restaurants and bars all around..... the Staff were very good and spoke perfect english. The rooms were large, basic and comfortable, but don't expect luxury. But it is value for money and you're not dragging you suitcase over the cobbles for miles. We caught a water taxi to the airport very close by as well. Breakfast wasn't the grandest or greatest, but the coffee was superb!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent option!”
Reviews.Author: Alberto R
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Villa Rosa for my 5th time this European Autumn of 2011. My first stay there was in 1996. The location could not be better. Close to the train station and to Piazzale Roma but at the same time far from the noise of Lista di Spagna. The hotel is clean and the rooms are spacious. The breakfast is ok and people who work there are simply fantastic! From the recepcionists to the cleaners not forgetting the porter, MÃ¡ximo, they are so nice and cooperative! English and French are widely spoken. I will certainly go back once and once again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent for a Short Stay...”
Reviews.Author: Meg1423h
Reviews.Content: This hotel was pretty conveniently located for our 3/4 day weekend trip right off of the grand canal and only a few minutes from the train station with a great little place for breakfast less than a block away. If you're planning on spending a considerable amount of time in Venice it probably isn't the best choice, but for a few days and just a place to stay at night it does the job. The decor is a little old-fashioned and weird, and it's easy to miss the little side-street the hotel's located on but otherwise a nothing special it'll do the job kind of place.

Reviews.Title: “Best Choice for Budget Travellers”
Reviews.Author: Colour-Tour-Georgia
Reviews.Content: The hotels has very good location for budget travelers - just 10 min walk from Railway station. If you carry heavy luggage than this hotel is one of the best choice. Rooms well dressed but try to take a rooms on 2nd floor. On ground floor it's too noisy. Breakfast standard for this class. Staff - friendly. We had triple room and it was quite Ok.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Only_the_truth
Reviews.Content: 10 mins from bus station, 5 mins from railway, but hard to find as the alley leading to th e hotel is easy to miss. Bit of a nightmare with 2 cases, not helped by hotel having no lift and a spiral starecase on the 2nd floor. Reception & public areas are will kept & clean but it ends there. Room small, bathroom dirty with mould & balcony adorned with dead flower baskets (see pictures). Breakfast selection was limited & of poor quanity. Asked for cases to be kept for a few hours before we left for our cuise ship. No secure room available. Only option given by the unhelpful receptionist was to leave our cases in the very public breakfast room. Would you take the chance ? Booked this hotel because it got reasonable reviews in Tripadvisor but I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Difficult to find but great hotel, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Elyse682
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a triple room with an added bed for a single night in late August. The additional "bed" was more like two giant cushions put together - not ideal, but not uncomfortable, either. Pros: Clean Spacious yet cozy Air-conditioning worked well Close to the water bus stop Quiet at night Good variety for breakfast Extremely friendly and helpful staff, especially at the front desk Cons: Difficult to find - the hotel is located on a small, narrow street off the side of the main canal. We asked for directions several times and no one seemed to know where it was located.

Reviews.Title: “rare value in Venice”
Reviews.Author: choppers-on-tour
Reviews.Content: This hotel is central enough to be convenient for everything, but tucked away enough to be nice and quiet. We found all staff to be very helpful, and the rooms while not luxurious, were quite adequate. Breakfast was better than expected, but still pretty basic. The main plus of this hotels is that they offer reasonable value for money in a grossly overpriced (but amazing) city.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: blackbond_11
Reviews.Content: Quiet hotel, not far from the train station. The room and bathroom were clean. Loved the massive shutters that blocked sunlight and noise, wanted to bring them home. There is a computer available in the lobby for a nominal fee.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Quiet Location, Good value for money in Venice”
Reviews.Author: ritsos86
Reviews.Content: Our room, number 38, was at the top of the hotel and therefore was fairly warm. The air-con wasnt brilliant but the compensation was a very large room with a big, fully functioning bathroom. Shutters were very effective at keeping out the light and the noise of which there was very little. Breakfast was adequate. Yogurts, cerals, meat, cheese and breads. Staff were friendly and hotel was clean. Location was excellent, 5 minutes walk to the train station (ten to the bus station). Overall, very happy with the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good price, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: merryth
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a lovely change after the chain hotels, rooms with character, large for a European hotel. Breakfast is fine but personally I prefer an espresso and a pastry in a cafe with the locals. The location could not be easier if you arrive at St Lucia even with baggage you can walk to the hotel. Rooms are air conditioned and it worked fine for us. The vaporetto stop is also really accessible and an easy way to explore Venice. The best advice we found was just wander it is by far the most fun way to find the best of Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jeanne86
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in July, we had two rooms one double, one triple. Both rooms were very good. The air conditioning worked just fine, and the beds were comfortable. The front desk were very helpful and answered all our queries. The location was only a 10 minutes walk to the train station and there were many cafes and shops nearby. I would definitely stay at this hotel again and would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “bad service from hotel villa rosa venice italy”
Reviews.Author: shane_rn27
Reviews.Content: we stayed at hotell villa rosa because it was given to us by the agent at the train,station, 'since it is our first time to visit venice , we are excited, we checked in the hotel and we noticed the room is too warm, we open the aircon but the system is not enough to cool down the room, we asked the front desk to check the room which they did, ac is working but its not enough to cool down the entire room,, we ended up requesting an electric fan that is broken and never rotate from side to side just to make us more comfortable, the guy is very accomadating and said we cant get other room since its packed and we just wait in the morning to talked to the front desk, we were able to sleep around 1 am and we are sweating bad, mentioned the situation to the front desk and she look sarcastic , Malina was her name, went to check the room and said its working since i can feel air, she shows attitude to asked stating that we just want our money back , we just want them to know that our stay there is uncomfortable, languauge is a barrier, very demeaning person and hope we should have went to other hotel who is more costumer friendly, Too bad our visit to venice is not good, hotel personnel like Malina should go back to school and learn proper etiquette. stating that we just want our money back without asking for it is very rude, hope other people who go this hotel will be comfortable, because we paid to get rest and get the best and not treated as if you will screw them. hope they can fix this problem so the next patron will never experienced what we been through, paying much what we dont deserve

Reviews.Title: “V Close to station / Bus terminal/ Water Buses.”
Reviews.Author: warey55
Reviews.Content: If you don't want to drag cases around Venice this small hotel might be for you. We arrived at Marco Polo airport and booked our return ticket by coach into Venice at the airport. Make sure you go with ATVO as this is a direct transfer to Piazzale Roma. no stops and takes 20/25 minutes approx. There is another ticket sales booth beside atvo called ACTV which is also a bus company this is the Venice public-transit agency, and is just like our buses with regular stops picking up and setting down passengers so will take much longer to arrive at Piazzale Roma. We paid â‚¬ 18 return with ATVO for the two of us. ( Fri to Mon ) We had hired a car to pick up at airport on the monday ! When you arrive at Piazzale Roma walk towards the station over the bridge carry on past station on your left, pass another bridge on your right carry on walking, you are in a small street with shops either side. Look to your left for a food outlet called Quanto Basta there is a small lane beside it, if you look on the floor Albergo S Lucia is written here in mosaic form. Walk down this narrow lane pass hotel Albergo, less than 100 yrds, the Villa Rosa is now visible, ( see Pics ) take next right (small alley) entance a couple of paces on your left. No more than a 10 min walk from coach park. The hotel was very clean and we were warmly greeted. Our room was small, but functional, hey I've no intentions of staying in watching TV. The air condition unit was working fine and boy did we need it. Bathroom was clean shower small but ok. My only moan would be that the matress was as solid as a board, so be warned, we were so exhausted after a days exploring we soon drifted off. Breakfast was a buffet affair basic but adequate, save some money on buying food, fill up here ! Tip, we bought 48 hour tickets for vaporetto water buses from a Tobacc shop. Turn left out of alley walk over bridge shop on right ( 5 min wlk ) saves queing at ticket office, your call. Be aware this small shop does not take credit cards. You have to validate your ticket on a small machine at water bus stop, use as a swipe card hold within 6 cm of the circular panel for three seconds, or until you see a green light and hear a beep. If you don't validate ticket you will receive a substantial fine if card checked by employee. We never saw anyone checked or even asked to see tickets in our 4 days on these boats. We validated ours on our second full day so got an extra day unlimited travel. ( I know naughty. ) If you travel to Lido they have automatic barriers like london underground so you have to validate there !! Worth a visit though lovely free beach, even use same ticket to ride on buses. Enjoy Venice, my best tip is to wander around and get lost I mean it, Venice is really safe and we felt at ease we never felt threatened.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location and friendly staff - main reasons to come back =))”
Reviews.Author: Dmitry_Sytin
Reviews.Content: We can advice you to visit this nice hotel near railway station Santa Lucia. All was good, but there aren't any shelvs in the bath, old furniture and pure breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Venetian Gem!”
Reviews.Author: italiamia11
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at Hotel Villa Rosa and it was very nice. We chose this hotel family run hotel after reviewing Trip Advisor and we were not disappointed. The hotel is a very short walk to the train station and we did not have to cross any bridges with luggage. The area is very busy with tourists but we did not have any trouble and felt safe. The hotel is a little bit down the alley from the main strip which made our stay pleasant and quiet. The hotel is within walking distance of the tourist sites and if necessary, the vaporetto is nearby too. If you want to go to Murano, the boat MD (Murano Diretto), is next to the train station and is very convenient, but Ruggiero at the front desk offers a three island tour which sounds very good and reasonable. The hotel staff is very welcoming. Enrico, Martina and Ruggiero were all very accommodating, friendly and helpful. They were made us feel comfortable and answered our questions with a smile. We arrived in Venice very late and exhausted after many delays due to an accident on the train system, but Ruggiero was very helpful and checked us in quickly so we could get some rest. Great service! We started our beautiful days in Venezia with a nice breakfast an ended with a good nights sleep. The breakfast was fresh and adequate for a two star and the coffee was very good. The breakfast room was very clean and the service was excellent. We had a quadruple room that was on the main floor in the garden. We had a little patio area with a bench and a bistro set so that you could sit outside and enjoy. Our room was big enough, clean and quiet with comfortable beds. The bathroom was clean but a little small. At night the bathroom door noise was a little annoying and the shower door came off the track but we managed. We were very satisfied with our accommodations. I would highly recommend Hotel Villa Rosa, especially to those traveling by train and on a budget that want to stay in Venice. Thank you Hotel Villa Rosa for making Venezia enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “For what you pay, you can't go wrong!”
Reviews.Author: deathlyhellos
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at Villa Rosa for 2 nights in July 2011. The hotel is in a great location, down a little alley off the main street near the train station, bus station and one of the main ferry stops. It takes 25-35 mins to walk anywhere in Venice from the Hotel. We didn't need public transport, except when changing islands! Our room was spacious and clean. A slightly sterile smell, but at least we knew it was getting cleaned. The bed was large and comfortable, the room airconditioned with a good bathroom and TV. The staff were friendly and always helpful. Wifi and internet cost extra, but it was a good connection. Breakfast was included and was simple, but lovely. Also has a cute little courtyard to have some drinks before heading out for dinner. We paid 80 euro a night, which considering how expensive Venice is and the quality of the hotel and service, it's a real bargain. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stephen S
Reviews.Content: OK it took a little finding but it's in a great location especially for dining out at night. I think the restaurants a much better at this end of venice and much better value for money. Also ideally located for the water taxis. We were in a double room on the top floor and had a nice little balcony. The room was very clean and nicely fitted out with plenty of clothes hangers. Just far enough from the main street to be quiet at night, about 75 meters. The staff were very friendly and helpful and breakfast was good. Excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Here's your directions! No Elevator! Nice courtyard. Dated rooms”
Reviews.Author: misundrstd
Reviews.Content: Ok, so the staff here were very friendly and helpful,and the breakfast was nice, but that was only after we finally found the place. It is only a 3 min walk from the train station. As you walk down the train station stairs and are looking at the canal make a left. You will be passing a bridge on your right and walking into a very narrow "street" full of shops. After about 20 steps you will see another even smaller "street" on your right. It barely has enough room for 2 people to cross paths. This is the street to the Villa Rosa. It is straight ahead. There are no elevators, so keep your luggage light. I ended up with the only room between the courtyard and the breakfast room, wich was not a good place to try and sleep. People sat in the courtyard socializing late into the evening and then more people were bustling in and out of the breakfast room early in the morning. Rooms themselves were clean but dated. Shower was small and hard to keep floors dry. Had a TV but couldn't figure out how to do anything but listen to the radio on it and that was after I climbed onto a chair to jiggle cords. The bus station is not far but it IS over a VERY steep stepped bridge. A local charged 10 euro to help us get out luggage across to catch a bus to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “definitely want 2 come back 2 venice and stay here again!!!!”
Reviews.Author: kiwitarsh
Reviews.Content: this hotel was wonderful!!!! i was on an intrepid trip, and our trip leader bought us here and it was superb!! the lovely friendly man who checked us in, was a real laugh:-) very funny and very helpful indeed. the hotel is literally 100/200m from the main train station terminal so even with a big backpack on, it wasnt that bad!!! rooms were nice and clean and the breakfast for 5 euros was outstanding!! and the ladies who served us in pink uniforms, very professional - espresso outstanding:-)

Reviews.Title: “great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: sahmed76
Reviews.Content: so wasn't sure what to expect but was very pleasantly surprised. super close to train station (which was key since we had an early morning train to catch), good breakfast, staff was very accomodating (helped book a vivaldi concert for us) and although the room and bathroom were european small we thoroughly enjoyed our stay for 3 nights. the hotel is very close to stores and restaraunts but amazingly quiet at night. for the price it was perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, quiet, good value”
Reviews.Author: rodsant039
Reviews.Content: Good location-near train Venice Train station, near busses station and near "vaporetto" stations; clean room; small restroom-small shower area; very quiet area-nice and easy to sleep; excellent TV channels available-has like "cable" channels; excellent individual air conditioner that can be controlled at each room; very nice staff both at counter (24hour service) and well as at breakfast area. Nice breakfast as well as nice breakfast area. Very reasonable rates for telephone calls to USA.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful in every way.”
Reviews.Author: jmjx2
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel after an overnight flight and without luggage. The lady who checked us in was wonderful, she checked on our luggage and brought us in for coffee. Everyone we encountered at the hotel was helpful and so friendly. The hotel is very close to the train station and we could easily walk everywhere. Our room was very clean and we had our own balcony. Thank you to Hotel Villa Rosa for making our stay so wonderful. We will stay with you again.

Reviews.Title: “nice little hotel, very happy with our choice”
Reviews.Author: al_oz79
Reviews.Content: enjoyed our stay, staff were great very helpful, great location, and easy access from train station ( biggest bonus) our standard room was a good size, had double and single bed in there, bathroom was clean and also a good size. ok breakfst would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff, Good Location, Interesting Price, Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: davidloncke
Reviews.Content: Management and Staff The staff of the hotel is in general very friendly and helpful! The receptionists are always ready to answer all your questions and to give you all kinds of advice! Thanks to the receptionist, we found out that the bustickets we had bought to travel back to the airport on departure were for the wrong buscompany, this would have caused us great trouble early in the morning with possible loss of airplane, thanks to the receptionist this got avoided. The receptionists also helped us to check in online to our flight back home and to print our boarding passes. Above that they arranged a picknick bag for us on the day of departure because we left before the normal breakfast time! Location The location of the hotel is great, it's at 5 minutes walk from the bus and trainstation, also the Vaporeto stop is at just 5 minutes away. It's close to the center of Venice, 10 - 15 minutes walk to the Rialto and 20 - 25 minutes to San Marco. From the railway station other places are easy to reach, we traveled to Verona. Bedrooms The room we stayed in was very taken care off, it had a good bed and looked nice. There was a TV with a whole load of channels. The bathroom had a good shower with warm water and a little terrace. The only thing was that sometimes the room was rather warm and the heating wasn't really controlable. But that's just a little detail, we just opened our window for a while when we felt it too hot. Food The breakfast was OK! Much better than we had in Italy before! There was bread, a Croissant, ham, cheese, jam, chocolate, honey, butter...Coffee, thee...Yoghurt...All well taken care off! Services The hotel has wireless internet access in the hotel lobby. It works good!

Reviews.Title: “Walkable distance from Venice station and very clean and nice customer service”
Reviews.Author: AlokKumar
Reviews.Content: Although this hotel is a bit costly but I enjoyed my stay. This hotel is walkable distance from Venice station. Receptionist was so friendly and helpful. They provide baby cot with no extra charge and 24 hr hot drinking water for baby food. Room was really clean and very well decorated.

Reviews.Title: “mixed bag”
Reviews.Author: walkaround
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located near train station so you don't have to roll your luggage up and down steps. Also low-priced relative to Venice standards. Hotel staff is friendly and helpful. Wireless internet connection available for purchase for use in lobby. Located in a quiet neighborhood. However, the accomodations are below average. The rooms are tiny. I could only open my door about halfway because it hit the nightstand. Little is convenient: no soap dish in the shower, no TP wall holder, 1 electric outlet inconveniently placed, etc. Walls are paper thin. If you have a noisy neighbor (I did), you'd better bring earplugs. Tiny,, old CRT TV. No AC (but there's a ceiling fan). Breakfast is adequate but pedestrian. Don't know how it compares to other similarly-priced hotels in Venice, but it was definitely a below average experience for me.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel with friendly and helpful staff in great location.”
Reviews.Author: TMerifield
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night before our cruise and were delighted with everything. The young man on reception was so helpful with directions to the cruise port, giving us maps and telling us how to get around. The location is great, close to the shops and restaurants and the Grand Canal. We got the air con remote from reception and thank goodness were able to cool the room down a bit as it was very hot. The bathroom was very clean, modern and spacious. The price is very good value for central Venice. We would definitely go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accommodation and breakfast for price.”
Reviews.Author: Katkos
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights which is ample for Venice. Excellent clean room, breakfast was great but the biggest hi-light for this place was the owner who worked behind the desk. Always sincerely friendly with great advise. He smiled with his heart. We were glad San Marco was a quite a walk away as only by walking do you get to see this amazing place.

Reviews.Title: “A gem!”
Reviews.Author: owly123
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this place twice, once with my family and the next year with my boyfriend. I loved Villa Rosa, it's very conveniently located, the rooms are beautiful and clean, and the staff is very nice. There were lots of other guests but it was never noisy, and the area is quiet (but close to Ferrovia and several vaporetto stops). For the price I thought it was a great find, and would heartily recommend it for family holidays and/or romantic getaways.â€Ž

Reviews.Title: “what a lovely place to stay”
Reviews.Author: gaywitch
Reviews.Content: my friend and I have just returned from a holiday in italy.This was my friends first time in italy and we decided to stay for one night in Venice.We read lots of reviews and decided on the Villa Rosa.Nice and close to the bus station,so it was easy to find,and what a find it was.We arrived early and were greeted by two lovely people at reception,our room was ready and after filling out the nessesary details up we went.What an absolute delight it was.A good size twin room,the walls covered in the traditional silky material just as it would have been years ago,but with the added advantage of on-suite modern plumbing.Later after walking for hours we went back to the hotel and bought a bottle of wine to drink on the little terrace before going out for dinner.This was opened for us and served in a bucket of ice as if it was the best champagne not just a cheap bottle .A lovely breakfast was served at 8am and our bags were kept for us while we went out for a few hours more.This lovely hotel is close to both the railway and bus stations and is close to the vaperetto stops so getting around Venice is easy The place is spottless the breakfast good and plenty,and the owners and staff go out of their way to make your stay lovely.what more could you possibly want.

Reviews.Title: “Charm, value and location”
Reviews.Author: ScottD15
Reviews.Content: This quaint little place is charming and certainly has a great location. My girls liked this hotel better than some 5 star places in Italy simply because it has character. The service was impeccable and the location can't be beat for access to the train station and vaporetto

Reviews.Title: “A safe bet”
Reviews.Author: bournan
Reviews.Content: Although located close to the railway station, the Villa Rosa is very quiet. Breakfast is good (although the coffee could be more Italian), the rooms clean, the service excellent. I shall certainly be back.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel for Venice Island”
Reviews.Author: pennae
Reviews.Content: This hotel is tucked away off the main strip, but in a great spot for getting to and from the train station! Hotels further away may have better views, but are also much more difficult to get to (stairs, bridges... expensive water taxis!). Staff were friendly (comedic at times!) and rooms were spotless, if tired. The airconditioning was an unexpected bonus, as was the little terrace we had infront of our room. Other twin rooms were much bigger (a friend's had a double and a single bed!) but we were happy enough with ours.

Reviews.Title: “Great little spot in Venice, easy walk from St. Lucia train station”
Reviews.Author: chrisnoc
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel at the reservation desk at St. Lucia train station when we arrived in Venice. I had checked out prices and locations prior to the trip but it was a last-minute deal and we were flying standby so we didn't want to book anything and lose a deposit. We were very pleasantly surprised at our find and the good value price we received especially considering it was Holy Week (week before Easter) in Italy. We had a little trouble locating the street and hotel from the directions we were given but it is a reasonable 5-10 minute walk from St. Lucia train station. We arrived at the hotel in the afternoon and checked in right away. The room was clean and efficient with enough space for the two of us. The beds were quite firm and the bathroom clean but small. The hotel is well kept but older and quaint. The hotel desk staff (especially Martina) was very helpful and accomodating to show us locations and recommend sights, shops and restaurants nearby. The breakfast room and sitting lounge is just off the entry lobby. The breakfast was a decent selection for a continental service with cereal, breads, pastries, meat and cheese slices and various juices. They serve coffee, espresso and capuccino to order. The breakfast room was usually quite busy but we were always able to locate a table right away. The hotel is located in the Cannaregio district near the first bridge over the Grand Canal at the Ferrovia Vaporetto stops. Most locations for sightseeing are within a 20 to 45 minute walking distance but you can catch the vaporetto to the other islands easily. If you plan to do much use of the waterbus it is best to purchase either a daily (24hrs for 18euro) or multi-hour pass as the cost can climb quickly at 6euro per ride. Obviously to go to Murano or Lido you will need to use one of the boat services. There are a lot of touristy shops and restaurants along the main passage following the Grand Canal so there is no shortage of options. There is a grocery and street market about a 10 minute walk further down past the alley leading to the hotel. If you go over the nearby bridge to St. Croce you will come across some less touristy and more authentic shops for items such as Murano glass and Venetian masks as well as some great food and some quaint out of the way and quiet campos for strolling and people watching. Overall I highly recommend the hotel and felt it was a good value. We paid 100 euro per night for a twin room for our 2 night stay from Wednesday to Friday. If we had booked by phone or via the internet prior to our arrival we would likely have gotten a better rate for those days but this was the lowest cost quoted by the reservation desk when we arrived. I look forward to returning!

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: DGXFrance
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is very convenient, it is not far from the main city attractions and it can be easily reached from the railway station. The staff is very nice, helpful and friendly. The rooms are clean, cosy and decorated in the old Venetian style. There is a very spacious balcony and you could have a very beautiful view! Overall, this hotel is a very good value for the price they charge.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but wouldn't stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Inedia
Reviews.Content: The hotel was extremely difficult to find but once found the welcome was warm. Our room was at the back overlooking a dingy yard, but was clean. The mattress was old and uncomfortable, the pillows very pitted and hard. The divan was torn and looked very unwelcoming. The bathroom was tiny and it was very difficult to move around as the bidet was always in the way. The shower cubicle was miniscule but there was always hot water. Breakfast was not appealing dry bread rolls were left out on the tables and in addition you were given one croisant. There were no fruit juices, well, there were juices, but goodness knows what they were, one taste of the 'orange' and I didn't bother again. There was 'plastic' ham and cheese but we decided to buy melon and bring that down to eat at breakfast. It was close to the railway station and water buses, but being so near the station the queues to buy tickets was always far too long. I would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fine for 1 star”
Reviews.Author: Merlin5
Reviews.Content: Location is great for the train station and 3 bridges to negotiate from the bus station. Room was compact but clean and warm with shower and plenty of storage. Breakfast was adequate as was the service - as mentioned by a previous poster - only 2 staff serving and they manage fine. Reception staff helpful. 20-30 minute walk to St Marks or a vaporetto (very convenient for the vaporetto stop outside the train station). Good location for reasonably priced restaurants and cafes. Good value for money by Venice standards. Would stay again.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Villa Rosa
HotelInfo.Address: Cannaregio 389, 30121 Venice, Italy
